column5: I think you mean Pat Quinn..
I think you meant Pat Quinn.   Burnsie has been gone for a while.
Never forget the time his face looked more black and blue then any player on the leafs.
ahhh crappy news for the hockey world.  RIP
LOL I was reading about Quinn and chatting to my son about Burns..you guys will be old eventually...

A true legend, when Quinn coached the leafs, and was doing drills on the ice, Darcy Tucker went up the ice with his head down, Quinn assumed Tucker new he was there, and that he would move out of the way, but he didnt, and ran into Quinn, and layed on the ice knocked out counting sheep, after he woke up Tucker said hitting Quinn was the hardest thing he has ever hit, and categorized it as like running into a train. Bobby Orr also took a few heavy hits from Quinn as well.  RIP   Quinn and Burnsie my 2 favorite coaches of all time

My wife said when her mom was alive "that would be a nice man for you mom".Have to agree,Pat was married,but the only coach she/mom liked..Have to agree,Pat YOU WERE A CLASS ACT SIR. Will miss you!!!!!
My dad coached with him in Vancouver. He was a great guy. Landry
Leafs are wearing this jersey to honour him tomorrow and Saturday.
Nice tribute to Pat @ tonight's Canucks game.  http://video.canucks.nhl.com/videocenter/console?catid=6&id=682210&lang=en
Had the pleasure of working with him for 6 years at the Leafs. Great man, would treat everyone the same no matter if you were Mats Sundin or the guy who changed the garbage bags.
Great man, would treat everyone the same no matter if you were Mats Sundin or the guy who changed the garbage bags.  Now that, IMHO, is a true sign of class!!
